name: Cypress In

reviews.text: I was forced to stay here when my original B&B lost my reservation. This hotel is more of a hostel but charges rates like a hotel. The rooms we had were on the third floor and the stairs were small and hard to navigate with our luggage. The rooms were basic and bare with no views out the window and A/C only worked in one room that we had. The rooms had 2 twin beds and space for our luggage and that was about it. The 2 showers and bathroom were shared (not adjoining the room) by everyone on the floor. The hotel is in a great location for nightlife, restaurants and especially shopping BUT it is right next to a club which BLASTS music until 6am. So members of our party couldn't sleep. I would not stay here again and was happy I only had to stay for one night.
reviews.title: More of Hostel than hotel near Palermo Soho

likes.disliked: — Loud clubs played music all night, A/C only worked in 1 room, Shared bathroom

reviews.text: I agree with the other reviews. The Japanese inspired decor is a bit random and the staff is young and a bit scattered. However I will take random pictures on the wall given the other attributes of the property.
reviews.title: Decent for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However the entire place is clean, the furnishings are new, fresh paint, cold AC, and the staff manages to do a reasonable job. Most rooms (maybe all) have shared baths, but they were impeccably clean with new marble countertops and large showers. We had a bad experience at another B&B in the same price range in Palermo, so I do not think these things should be ovelooked.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plus it is in a GREAT location in the heart of Palermo Soho.
reviews.title: It's okay

description: Cypress In B&B, 13 suites, sobriety & nature with style in Soho, Buenos Aires.
